intro: Memecylon viswanathanii, commonly known as the Nilgiri memecylon, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense evergreen forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
